customers_say.summary: Customers find this laptop ultra-fast, with quick program loading and instant-on capabilities. The device features an elite CPU, crisp display, and premium build quality, with one customer noting its solid magnesium-aluminum alloy construction. Moreover, they appreciate its battery life, with one mentioning it lasts nearly the whole day, and its portability, being ideal for travel. Additionally, customers consider it good value for money.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Finally, a proper Macbook Air Competitor
reviews.review:
Years ago, I had the original Surface Laptop, and I loved it. It remains one of my favorite laptops of all time.So before I purchased the Surface Laptop 7, I actually had a 14" 2021 Macbook Pro. It was honestly too much laptop for my needs, but the limited port selection on the Macbook Airs ruled them out for me. Of course, my Macbook Pro was better than the Surface Laptop 7 in many ways - the mini-LED screen is just about the best laptop display you can get, full-stop, whereas the Surface's display is good but not great. The speakers on the Macbook were amazing; the Surface's are quite good but can't compete in that regard.However, I don't regret my purchase for one second because the Surface Laptop 7 is really a Macbook Air competitor, and that is where it shines. I compared the Surface and Macbook Air 13" side by side and came away with the following conclusions:-Screen: I don't do any serious photo editing or graphic design. To me, the Surface screen is slightly better. It gets much brighter than the Air and colors seem more accurate. However, the Air has better black levels. The Surface is a touchscreen, but I never use it as I don't like fingerprints on my screens. However, if you want a touchscreen, the Surface is clearly the better option. The Surface also has a 120hz display, whereas the Air is stuck at 60hz. The difference in smoothness when scrolling or using trackpad gestures is very noticeable. The Surface's screen looks much smoother.-Speakers: I can't tell the difference between the two. The Surface's speakers are really good compared to other laptops in this class. The same is true of the Macbook Air.-Ports: I had hoped that by 2024, USB-A would be all but gone, but alas it is not. It was very annoying to have to carry around dongles to use USB-A devices on my Macbook Pro, and now I don't have to! The Air has only two USB-C ports, so clearly the Surface wins here. The Macbook Pro does have HDMI, which is nice, but I just bought a USB-C to HDMI cable that I carry around with me, so I don't need a dongle for that either.-Keyboard: I like that the Macbook Air has more than 3 levels of brightness control, but I slightly prefer the key feel on the Surface.- Trackpad: somehow, the Surface's trackpad is better. I am thrilled that Microsoft finally brought a haptic trackpad to the Surface lineup. It feels more delicate and the tactility is stronger. Macbook trackpads are still among the best in the business, but there is finally a Windows laptop that is comparable in this regard.-Login: hands down, Windows Hello is better than the fingerprint reader. It's so fast that my Surface often logs me that it feels like the laptop was left unlocked. The fingerprint scanner on Macbooks are very good, but they are not as fast, nor as convenient, as Windows Hello. My Macbook Pro could also unlock with my Apple Watch, but that almost always took longer than unlocking with my finger.-Build Quality: This has always been a strong point for Surface devices, and the Surface Laptop 7 doesn't disappoint. The laptop can be opened easily with one hand, and the fit and finish is flawless. The same is true of the Macbook Air. I can't say whether one is better than the other. The Surface is designed to be easier to service, however, and you can actually replace the SSD, which is very nice. Additionally, the black finish on my Surface is more resistant to showing fingerprints than the dark blue on the Macbook Airs, which is a fingerprint magnet.-Performance: After owning an Apple Silicon laptop, I could never go back to using an x86/x64 processor. I used Windows 11 for ARM on my Macbook for two years virtualized in Paralells, so I knew what I was getting into. All of the applications I need work beautifully on the Surface, and it is so darn fast. Of course, there are more powerful processors out there using traditional x64 architecture, but I have never used a Windows laptop that is just so snappy for every day tasks. Office apps open in 1-2 seconds. Firefox, Chrome, and Edge open in less than a second. Using gestures to swipe through apps is super snappy, and the high refresh rate screen makes transitions look so smooth. This is the kind of performance I came to except from my Apple Silicon Macbook, and it's wonderful to finally see Windows operating just as responsively.Overall, the Surface feels like an upgrade over my Macbook Pro, and I personally am fine with the tradeoffs that come with the thinner, smaller, and lighter Surface over the more powerful Macbook Pro. It is an utterly fantastic laptop that, in my opinion, is currently the best thin-and-light laptop in the world.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2025
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Elegant Computing Defined
reviews.review:
This incredible, beautiful, elegant and productive laptop showcases what Microsoft is truly capable of, and I'm a Linux guy. I bought the big one - 15" screen, 32 gig RAM, elite CPU. It is a powerhouse of a laptop.Now - there is one con, but as time progresses the problem becomes less and less of a problem and that is the ARM architecture vs standard Intel x86/64. Basically, this laptop uses a newer, different CPU architecture, which means that many applications don't work yet (YET!!). Almost everything I threw at this laptop worked out of the box and worked beautifully. There were some older applications that didn't work (SimCity Deluxe for example). But and this is a huge BUT - as time passes more applications are supported (or emulated effectively) and it becomes less and less an issue.With the 1 CON out of the way, let's talk about how amazing this laptop is:Premium feel (shell and keyboard). As good as or even better than a MacBook. Yes, for real.Speakers sound delightful.The 15"-inch sounds like a big laptop but fits perfectly in my backpack and it is still light and small. I mean, unless you are a 5'2" petite tiny person I don't see how this 15" laptop is too big for someone.It is plenty fast for doing all sorts of productivity like writing papers, excel spreadsheeting, music, internet, YouTube etc. Understand this isn't a fancy Chromebook. Operating System / Applications are exceptionally fast. This laptop WILL make you more productive just by opening it. It makes you want to work it's so nice.Battery life is OUTSTANDING. If you aren't glued to this laptop for hours at a time the battery will last DAYS. Literally days.Touchpad is also legit. No problems with cursor moving around (palm detection) and typing. Just legit good.Even when watching movies it doesn't get hot. Temperature is steady and cool. I love ARM.In closing, get this laptop. It's nice. Really nice. Like honestly, the nicest laptop I've ever owned (I've had the ASUS ROG 2024, two Dell XPS 15's, Razer Blades, etc.,)For my fellow nerds in the crowd:VMWare & Vbox do NOT work. Remember that ARM is a RISC architecture and neither products support ARM (yet). Docker Desktop for Windows DOES work on ARM. Also, WSL 2.0 also works just fine.Also, with the advent of cloud, lightweight servers (I run a small cloud on my home network) we don't need powerhouse laptops anymore if you have supporting infra. When I'm on travel I just VPN into my home network and I have all the resources I need. So keep something light and portable to work from :)
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2025
reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    ARM is just flat out better
reviews.review:
After moving to ARM, the surface has insane battery life and thermal throttling is a thing of the past.I can play a decent amount of indie steam games (think Hollow Knight, Ori, Stardew) and not get thermal throttled at all. It also handles emulation up to the PS2(most games*)/PSP like a champ (many ARM versions exist for emulators now too, so thats a plus!)Honestly, microsoft did good here. You can still run traditional exes built for x86/x64 and it will emulate the instructions to ARM (very cool) and it runs native ARM executables.I'm not a huge fan of its dedicated weird charging port... and I had to get a stronger usb cable for charging and a stronger battery bank that supported the wattage required for this thing to even recognize it as a charger for whatever reason.. But otherwise good.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This Surface PRO 11 ARM PC is not worth the aggravation !
reviews.review:
This Surface PRO 11 ARM PC is not worth the aggravation ! Had it one month. Locked up on restart and had to send it to Microsoft to get it to restart. After it was it returned it get locking up on restart. Didn't know if it hardware compatibility problems so I went thru one by one eliminated those which meant wiping PC clean and restarting from USB boot drive and reloading. The I starting eliminating software. Finally found that the problem was restoring Pictures and Music files from backup hard drives. Apparently the ARM takes a long time to actually finish copying the data to the C: drive and I was restarting before it was finished. Even though the dialog box shows that process is complete it is still running in the background and it takes like 30 minutes or more to finish copying everything over.  I checked the properties of the input folders to the output and they were the same but the process was still running in the background.  What's the point of a fast processor is it runs like an old XP PC? I would have returned the PC but my return date was 3/3/2025 and when I got all this figured out I was a day late!
  
Read more

I need this tablet for school, and I couldn't possibly use this in class as it would be a huge noise distraction. I adjusted the battery to recommended setting, updated, and restarted all like 3 times. Nothing worked. It's going back to this shady company, and I will not purchase anything from them again. reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great school tablet
reviews.review:
I really like this Surface Pro 7. It is exactly as advertised with one exception. The battery life is nowhere near what is advertised. On battery saving mode, using only Onenote for taking class notes, it lasts about 4 hours. Fortunately it charges up very quickly though. I can't see any way that I would get a full days use out of a full battery charge in any circumstance. In my case that is not very important because I am always around an outlet but if you need a tablet that will last all day away from a power source you will have a problem. The camera is good enough, not as good as the Apple camera, but I don't really use it as a camera anyway. I use mostly the 365 programs and find that it integrates these programs seamlessly. Onenote comes with the tablet and has been an amazing app for my vet school classes.  It saves my many hours of study time. My only issues are with the instability of Onenote. It closes itself down every few minutes and is very frustrating. I'm sure there is a fix for this but I'm also sure that I won't get it from Microsorft as they have a technical support team that is on par with the customer service team at the cable company. I've contacted them 3 times now and my issue is never addressed. I was actually told to contact Amazon since they sold it to me. It seems like after spending a thousand dollars on Microsoft products they would at least provide a bit of tech support.  I'll just have to scour the web for a fix to this I guess. Overall I would recommend this tablet to every student. It seems to be a fantastic and fast machine.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Don’t buy the surface pro 7 from amazon
reviews.review:
Well where do i start..... i ended up getting my item and everything was good for about 20mins of use... however after 20mins my screen would freeze for 10-30 secs. I blew it off at first but then it happen 10mins after then it became a often issue. So i ended up going for an exchange. (The worst idea I’ve ever had). I called up amazon and told them my issue and they were quick to get me a replacement so as first i was satisfied until the surface pro 7 came in the next day. I open the box to find out the box it comes in is not only damage but in a renewed box didn’t even come in the same box it should have come in, then i open that to see the surface pro and the screen film wrapped around it was really dirty as if they dropped it in dirt or so and fingerprints all over the machine. So at this point I’m just hoping it works. This one was not charged at all at 15% like it usually is if you were to buy from Microsoft or an apple device would normally be. So i put it on the charger to find out that it not only has screen tear straight down the middle of the screen but a big red dot half the size of the screen was on there as if they drop the surface pro. So at this point i immediately call amazon and i talked to a representative that ended up giving me a hard time about another replacement even though this one was obviously there fault. So i ended up talking to a supervisor that ended up giving me a hard time as well and in the she said to me that they only do a exchange once but as a one time exception they’ll do the exchange to which i responded with i only want to do the exchange if it’s a brand new product that they are giving me not a renewed one and undamaged. To which she agreed that she would make sure it would be done and put in her notes so the wear house  knows. Well the next day came and guess what.... the man that drops it off throws my package at the wall of my house from a big distance he didn’t see me at all so when i raced over the man jumped in his car and quickly drove away knowing what he did. Not only this but when i open the box the surface pro again was in a dirty renewed box, at this point I’m just hoping it still even worked again no power so i plug it in and guess what it works surprisingly after all that. However i Notice something was different with the boot up process so i knew something was wrong i go to the setting of the computer and the version i bought was 8gb of ram i5 model with 128gb of memory the one i receive as a replacement this time was a 4gb version i5 model with 128gb of memory and GUESS WHAT A DIFFERENT GRAPHICS CARD AS WELL. The surface pro 7 i got not only had 4gb of ram which was wrong but a different graphics card as well that comes in a surface pro 5 are you serious.... so i called up customer service again asking for a supervisor yet again..... just wanting a refund the man told me well i see here that you have a couple of exchange for this device already so i told him this story i am telling now and ask him i wonder why i have “a couple of exchanges” to which he said well instead of a refund i can get you a brand new one and told me how he had to make a couple of phone calls to do this for me so i told him this is the last exchange I’ll be getting ill be asking for a refund next like i previously wanted..if the next one comes in the renewed box which that would mean it’s used.. if it’s broken or the wrong model I’m done with trying and I’m done with the surface pro 7. not only was this the worst experience with amazon that I’ve ever had and worst costumer Service but now I’m going to hate the surface pro 7 because of this. I’ll see what i receive next as of 02/23/2020Sorry for the long review but i felt my experience should be shared for others to see.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It is even better than you expected it to be...
reviews.review:
My previous laptop was a godzilla, 15 inch monitor, weighs like 3 pounds or something (2014 model). I was looking for something that had the horsepower for what I needed, but also the lightness to carry it around. Although battery life isnt, the best, I DON'T MIND!This thing is a beast! Im very happy running programs like tableau, zoom, excel, powerpoint, all at the same time and with various files and this thing doesn't even flinch. The first few hours setting up and downloading all the programs it felt a big sluggish and I was starting to get worried. Once that was done, it started to fly.Yes, the rotating screen isnt as flawless as apple's iPad. That said, I bought this not to look pretty, i bought it to be my tool in battle. Being able to run all the programs that a regular PC can run is the main decision I went for Microsoft Surface.  The only downside is that Microsoft is a bit costly on the accessories front.I recommend this piece of tech to anyone who needs to travel or is on the move.  I'm a relatively big guy and i've had no major problem with the size of the keyboard. I do put it FLAT on tables because my keystrokes tend to be pretty hard and the keyboard is the most (in my opinion) fragile of the accessories.Lastly, the Pen interface is not perfect YET but oh man, as a first timer working with it, it kicks total ass and makes note taking in OneNote a complete positive trip.

reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on January 22, 2021
reviews.title: Best 2-in-1 for students and educators!
reviews.review:
I am a student-teacher. As such I have to take notes, as well as make lessons for students. This device is fantastic for note-taking and creating documents for schools. The screen is beautiful, and while I wish the bezels were as slim as they were on the surface pro x, I think the bezels are still fine and you tend not to notice them when you're using the device. With a resolution of 2736x1824 (yes, it's a weird resolution) on a 12.3 screen, everything is tack sharp and it has good colour accuracy. I do have a screen calibration tool and did notice quite the difference after calibrating it, but most people will be fine with the base settings.I wouldn't recommend getting the base model (i3 and 4GB ram) since let's be honest, a 4GB ram shouldn't even exist at this point. I think the i5 is the sweet spot, since the i7 isn't really that much better, along with whatever storage option you think you'd need. I'm okay with 256GB. Also, note it does have expandable storage via a micro SD card up to 1TB. The performance on this device is also great about 95% of the time. I get a few weird issues and stutters from time to time, but that is most likely due to windows being windows.The weakest point of this device would definitely be the battery life. While there are worse options out there, I do wish that the battery was slightly better. Having a lot of virtual meetings given the pandemic requires a lot of webcam use and multitasking, and I find that after a couple of hours the battery is already around 30% - with battery-saving mode enabled. When you're not doing that, and you're doing just standard web-browsing and media consumption, you'll be looking at a solid 5-6 hours minimum at acceptable brightness levels.Another negative is that while yes, this device is great, but if you want the full experience, you still have to purchase the type cover, which is another $150+ and the surface pen, which is another $100. So keep in mind that whatever option you choose, you're going to be spending another $300 after taxes.Overall though, writing notes on this device is fantastic, especially if you already use Microsoft 365. I think you can get by with the battery life, and you won't be disappointed by the performance unless you are a heavy user.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2025
reviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Would Not Buy Again
reviews.review:
I recently purchased the Microsoft Surface Pro 7 (Renewed) with 256GB storage, i7 processor, and 16GB RAM and had a generally positive experience, though with some caveats.Pros:First, the condition of the device was impressive. As a renewed product, it looked and felt practically new. The 12.3-inch touchscreen is vibrant, responsive, and works well for both productivity and entertainment. The i7 processor and 16GB of RAM ensure smooth performance, even when handling demanding tasks like multitasking and running multiple apps simultaneously. For my daily work needs, the Surface Pro 7 provided solid reliability.The Windows 10 Pro system is easy to navigate, and the portability of the device is perfect for those who need a lightweight but powerful tablet/laptop hybrid. It's excellent for both work and leisure, especially with the sharp display and excellent touch functionality. Additionally, the Wi-Fi connection was stable, and the overall build quality was top-notch.Cons:Unfortunately, I did run into a significant issue with this device. Upon arrival, I noticed that the battery charging did not work. Despite trying several charging cables and outlets, it would not charge beyond a certain point, which was quite frustrating, especially for a device that’s supposed to be fully functional.However, I must commend the return process. The seller made it easy to return the product and issue a full refund, which was a relief. It’s reassuring to know that purchasing a renewed product doesn’t come with a high risk, as the return process was seamless and quick.Overall: While the product itself was in great condition for being refurbished, the battery charging issue was a deal-breaker. Thankfully, the excellent return and refund policy meant that I wasn’t stuck with a faulty device. I’m still interested in purchasing a replacement, but this experience showed me that buying renewed products can come with risks, even if the overall condition seems good.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very Happy So Far.  Looks and works like new.
reviews.review:
Just got my Surface Laptop 3 and I'm happy to report when I took it out of the box and inspected it, it looked like a brand new machine.  I was concerned when I ordered it based on the 2 reviews that this listing had, but I guess I lucked out.  The laptop itself is in excellent condition.  The only flaw I could find on the body is a 1mm scratch on one corner that I was able to cover/hide with a black sharpie.  Now you don't even see it.  The screen is absolutely flawless.  The keyboard is flawless.  Sometimes with laptops, over time, the keys get faded or you notice that oily residue on them that doesn't wash off.  This keyboard looks like it's never been used.  The trackpad is perfect.  The only thing I can't speak to is the battery life remaining.  The "excellent" condition by this seller states that the battery is supposed to be above 80% life.  I've charged it fully and discharged it 2 times so far and it seems like the battery is fine.  All the ports work fine and I updated it to Windows 11 without issue.  The laptop came with a power adapter and that's all.  It was packed inside an inflatable bubble wrap and was well protected.  Seller shipped via Fed-ex 2 day shipping for free.  All in all, no complaints.  Very happy.  I did notice that the price fluctuates on this model from this seller.  Sometimes it's a little higher or lower than what I paid.  Not sure why.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    4 Stars vs Surface Pro series, but as the smallest, least expensive Surface, it is 5 Stars
reviews.review:
I'm a big fan of both the 12.3" Surface Pro (note: current screens are a little larger) and of the mini-me Go lineup. I own one of each of the first three editions of the Go (Go 1 w/10.1"; and the 10.5" Go 2 and Go 3). The latest Go 4 is sold through business channels only and hasn't shown up on any used websites yet.What I like (and don't like) about all the Go's:* Killer screen resolution and quality, definitely Amazon Prime-worthy. In settings, I increase the normal display from 150% to 175% for easier reading. You will want to stick with 150% if you have sharp vision and want to split the screen into two windows (I treat my Go's like an iPad, one full window at a time, and just switch windows to cut and paste or see another active program.* Infrared and visible light (camera) combine for highly secure facial scan log-ins. Microsoft wisely recommends using a PIN, custom password for this device, or the facial login so peepers (visual surveillance in real time or through security cameras) can't capture your Microsoft account log-in details. I find the system the the Surface uses to be the most trustworthy (imho equal to Apple facial recognitionand far superior to Android)* Front firing stereo speakers with good clarity (out of tiny slits on the left and right upper corners). Much better than Apple iPad's side-firing edge speakers.* Centrally located front and rear cameras, a good location for video calls. However, in my experience, the iPad 9 and 10 have a far superior microprocessor that provides much better video quality without stuttering. This isn't Microsoft's fault, it's Intel for falling so far behind Apple's in-house design custom chips. At least Microsoft got the camera lens locations perfect from day one, compared to Apple's awkward location on the middle of the side edge (until the iPad 10).* Anti-fall recharging - Microsoft uses a magnetically clamping on power connector that won't yank the table to the floor if you trip on the power cable. It also uses POGO conductive "dots" which means there is no "port" (plug hole) to get mangled over time and leave you unable to charge your tablet.* The single USB C port WILL also charge the tablet; in fact the Apple 18 watt C and Anker 18 or 20 watt C, chargers will easily re-charge the Surface Go even while you use it.* Screen shape is optimized for full-screen windows, with plenty of width for a normal typewriter page, and extra height compared to the wide angle screens on Android tablets and on most Windows and Chrome laptops. It is the same "aspect ratio" as it's bigger brothers, the Surface Pro's.* THAT BUILT-IN KICKSTAND. I've been waiting for years for a kickstand on the iPads, which I also love. First, you don't need an accessory case or cover so you can prop up the tablet on a desk or counter; all you need to do is fold out the kickstand. Second, if is VERY stable unlike an iPad screen cover folded to the rear into a little unstable triangle. And, unlike the iPad case covers and screen covers, you have a wide variety of viewing angles - continuously variable, not just a few clickable positions.* The factor keyboard requires no charging. The factory keyboard is illuminated. No "pairing" is required because the hinge on the factory keyboard magnetically snaps on to the bottom edge of the tablet and directly connects via the conductive POGO dots on the tablet and spikes on the keyboard.* There are more than 4  accessory keyboards to choose from. I have used Arteck, Inateck, and Omoton and they are all satisfactory - snap on magnetically just like the factory keyboard, but pair using Buetooth. The Omoton is preferred, in addition to being backlighted, it recharges with a C cable, instead of the now-obsolete Micro USB - so one less cable and perhaps one less charger (modern charges are C on both ends, the transition era of A on the charger and C on the cable end are over, although A=>C is how Amazon still ships their Fire tablets).* The clip-on accessory keyboards also cover and protect the screen while in transit.* On this Go TWO only (plus the later two models), the margins around the screen are narrower than on the Go 1, and the screen is .4" bigger.* The Go's all accept Micro SD cards, and you can go into settings and change the default file locations from the small 64gb internal storage (typically 11gb-25gb available) to the Micro SD card; I use a 256gb Samsung at $18 from Amazon for this purpose (I can only recommend Samsung, Patriot, and Sandisk). I strongly recommend Samsung, just look for A1 or A2 class for better performance, it doesn't run fast then slow down as it heats up, unlike some competitors.* ONLY THE Go 2-Go 4 RUN WINDOWS 11. This is critical since Microsoft is discontinuing security updates for Windows 10 at the end of this year.* Microsoft's current support for Word's online only version is superb; I no longer have to download either the shorter app version or longer full-version.*eMMC vs SSD vs EFS - the Go 1-3 models with 64gb hard drives use eMMC storage, which is a souped up micro SD card system. The Go 1-3 models with 128gb and up hard drives use full laptop and desktop grade SSD's. The Go 4 models, regardless of storage capacity, use UFS, which is  super-souped up micro SD card system. Supposedly, EFS is almost as fast as a low-end SSD but uses less power and takes up less space. According to test reports, the Go 1-3 with SSD's installed had way faster bulk file transfer speeds, and because they can read/write at the same time, better results in other key areas of performance. HOWEVER in typical use scenarios - YouTube, Spotify, writing - there was no subjective difference in performance.* There are some good deals on Amazon Renewed Surface Go 2's. A lot of companies and some schools use Go's instead of iPads, and close them out on regular cycles. It's not time for inexpensive Go 3's yet. In most cases, if you purchase a used Go 2, it will be a business model and will boot into Pro Windows (although you will need to manually update (by clicking a button) to Windows 11).Let's hit some negatives:* 64gb can end up with 11gb or so left for working space, if you go through all the updates after purchase (including updating to Windows 11). While the operating system is set to erase no-longer needed files monthly, I go into Settings=>Sytem=> Storage and click on Temporary Files and manually delete "Prior Windows Installations" to get my available storage back up to 25-30gb.* Multiple browsers eat up storage. I use just Edge and DuckDuckGo browsers; Edge is pre-installed, DuckDuckGo is either on the Microsoft Store or web.* I recommend charging separately. If I charge while using it, it develops a hot spot all the way across the top half. Intel really has some catching up to do with Apple and Android/ARM/Chromebooks on ARM in terms of heat and battery life.* Battery life is as little as 4 hours while watching YouTube or streaming services (as much as 7 hours on Google Docs or Microsoft Word online).* There's no such thing as a simple screen cover. It's keyboard cover, or hit the road jack.Recommendations.+ If you find the right size Dockem, a simple but very useful envelope style protetive cover, they work very well. You have to oversize them properly to allow for the keyboard cover. I suggest measuring things but add .5" to the size Dockem specs show; or get the next size up from iPad Pro 11 size. Of course you can cheap out and use an Amazon shipping bubble envelope instead, which is more low key through TSA and has your name and address on it for I.D.+ It's a touch screen, but even for videos I use the trackpad on the keyboard so I'm not always get finger print smudges.+ If it's only $30-50 more, 128gb is a more relaxed way to go.+ The built-in security software is very good imho; in 20 years I've stuck with it. However go into Security Settings and make sure Device Security is turned on in hardware options, and make sure you have Enhanced Hardware Security active.+ Don't give up if the initial setup and security updates and upgrade to Windows 11 seems to take forever; it does. Just do it on the kitchen counter while you do other stuff and otherwise respond to its occasional pleas for inputs from you. It is NOT as efficient as updating an iPad. But only the first experience is so bad it hurts. Thereafter, pretty painless+ Your reward is the most compatible operating system on the planet. With iPads and even Chromebooks, sometimes I want to pull my hair out with weird webpage glitches. Never with Windows.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on March 21, 2024
reviews.title: You get what you pay for, in this case, you get more than that.
reviews.review:
I had originally purchased an off brand tablet for about 100 dollars less than this one. As you would expect, it was garbage. It was slow, unreliable and just a perfect example of why buying "Chinese off brand" products is hit or miss.When I got my Surface (a full 7 days earlier than expected) I was absolutely blow away by the difference 100 dollars made. It arrived looking absolutely brand new. Honestly, the seller probably could have passed it off as new if they chose to.Setup was pretty straightforward, it runs Windows 10 and it's set to the desktop version so if you have a PC or laptop running Win10, there's almost no learning curve.The speakers are great considering the size of the tablet. Crisp clear sounds. I doubt I'll use it much for video but it's nice to know I can. The screen is clear and easy to read. The touch screen function might take a little getting used to as the OS isn't designed around that aspect, but it's not a big deal. Worst case scenario you can easily use a bluetooth mouse/keyboard.I can't comment on the battery life yet, but so far it doesn't seem like it'll be much of an issue.I bought this primarily for use in a course I'm taking so mostly word processing and web searching, and I don't forsee any issues in that regard.All said and done, buying refurbished electronics can be a little daunting at times, but I'm 100 percent happy with this particular purchase as well as the seller.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2022
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This worked on my cobbled-together PC build
reviews.review:
This is the magic USB stick you need to get a full, regular user license and run Windows legally on your custom PC build.  This Windows installed with no headaches (after a setting tweak in the System BIOS) and let me swap hardware around without complaining.  No complaints about new drivers going in either.  I got the Device Manager clean as a whistle.  You can use this USB stick to restore the system if it ever gets wiped out by malware or ransomware - just keep all your data in the cloud and your are bullet-proof.  After you build the system you can then sell it for money, as long as you include the Windows USB stick and the Key.  If you try to build many machines with the one USB stick and key you will find problems.  All that said - Windows 11 is not the best OS out there - but it's the one everyone expects.  Once you get GeForce Experience and Steam running it's all about the games.

reviews.review:
Advise giving a second thought to whether you really want a new PC. It is a pain and unless you are using it for an application where you have IT support you likely don’t need one.The PC is dying despite the advantages of its form factor and it is all Microsoft’s fault. They got a monopoly then used the power to make the user experience worse with every edition since at least Windows 7 and probably Windows XP remains the high point for Windows.The process of setting it up should be Microsoft’s chance to shine. Make a good first impression by having a product that just works. Instead you are stuck wasting time because you don’t have hardwired internet and have to lug the computer to the router. Then it doesn’t want to let you install without a Microsoft account. Then you buy the kids a game, and of course it remembers your credit card so they can easily order whatever they want without asking for the card. Not even a the dignity of a check box to not remember the card!The only consolation of a painful few hours setting up a computer is that this horrible user experience has driven the PC into collapse. I asked my wife if she wanted one along with my kids and while she had one for years in the bright days of Windows XP, she didn’t really care to get off her phone long enough to use a computer.

I assumed it might even have some minor chips or scratches in the glass screen around the edges, and there were, but again no big deal. What I was not expecting was multiple dead patches of pixels on the screen. I certainly wouldn't call that "good" condition when little scattered parts of the screen don't work. reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Not exactly pleased…
reviews.review:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    I’m pretty picky when it comes to my electronic purchases. However, I was taking a chance on this for a work trip because I didn’t want to lug my big laptop around.#1 the charger was not cleaned at all and it definitely grossed me out.#2 the charger only works in certain positions, this is not at all “like new” or “excellent condition”#3 the screen has damaged pixels which are decidedly not “excellent” condition or even “like new”The device itself was cleaned. But I would’ve rather paid for a new surface pro. I’m really disappointed and honestly going to be attempting to return. I took numerous videos of my unboxing and first time experience. If I could have uploaded more than 1 video I definitely would have.I’m sure everyone will not have the same experience as I. Just how about don’t lie about your product? Plenty of people would be happy with something like this but at a cheaper price. A damaged screen, unclean charger, and hardware that has to be fixed in a certain position to charge is definitely not “like new”, “excellent”, or even “refurbished”. Cool you wiped the device and threw it in a box. I’m not impressed.
  
Read more

customers_say.summary: Customers find the tablet functions well, with one noting the built-in kickstand works great, and appreciate its lightweight design that makes it easy to carry anywhere. reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2025
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Solid basic tablet
reviews.review:
If you want Windows on a beater tablet in the year 2025 this is the way to go. You absolutely want 8 GB of ram and the Core M3 chip to get a half way fluid desktop experience. The 4gb and Pentium gold version functions but it chokes so much even webbrowsing while downloading updates is janky and that makes it hard to use as a "normal computer". 128 GB is really also what you need as the 64gb version will have so much space taken up by windows, windows install files and hybernation files you will have to constantly juggle things to store more than a dozen GB unless you use a Microsoft card.Disable the fancy visual effects and it's just a very solid experience. Battery life is solid and the built in kickstand works great. Is it/should it be stuck with Windows 10? Yes, basically, but that's fine for the near future. If you have fixed needs this is just wonderfully "good enough"
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The original Surface Go was an abomination that shouldn't exist, this fixed everything wrong
reviews.review:
The original was unheard of - giving you amazing screen resolution on such an inexpensive device. However the low RAM and weak CPU meant it couldn't even keep up with the on-screen keyboard when you were typing. I don't want to mention the other things that went wrong with simple OS operations that should take 30 seconds ending up leaving me stuck for 20 minutes or more. I am running Windows 11 on this sucker doing the exact same workload, and it immediately fixed EVERY SINGLE COMPLAINT I had with the Go 1. The RAM and i3 CPU were what was badly needed! Now it's perfect. This is my robbery computer I carry to coffee shops in Colombia. If a thief ever takes it, he'll regret risking prison for something worth $100 resale max instead of robbing a young lady with a iPhone model worth far, far more.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Buyer Beware, Poor Quality Lack Reasonable Customer Service
reviews.review:
MAKE SURE YOU THOROUGHLY CHECK THAT YOUR DEVICE IS WORKING WHEN YOU RECIEVE IT.  I waited to long to check it and found I had a useless tablet. The Surface Pro 4 was purchased and left in box as a backup until needed. It was stored in a climate controlled office with other similar equipment.  It will only stay on when plugged in. Once you pull the plug, it turns off, so the battery is useless.  It also doesn't boot up normally.  Though I did not find these issues out until after the warranty period, I called Lifecycle Pro to see what we could work out.  I was willing to send back the tablet at my expense to have them fix the battery issue, or I was also willing to send it back and get a store credit on another tablet. Its my fault for not checking the condition of the device when it was received, so I get it. It was in the original box and not opened, so the problems it has now, would've been there upon receipt. I would've offered a customer some level of credit or something...Lifecycle Pro offered nothing.  Considering the 2 tablets I have purchased from them are of little to no value, They made a few hundred, offered subpar tech, and definitely lost our business.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2017
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The Perfect Solution to the Question: Do I Want a Tablet or Do I Want a Laptop?
reviews.review:
I absolutely love this computer. I had never seen any of the older versions in person, but when I played with my sister's Surface Pro 4 I was immediately sold. I literally ordered one the next day! I had been in the market for a new tablet, and thought maybe I wanted an iPad, but I just couldn't seem to pull the trigger. I don't like the mobile interface of apple products (despite loving the desktop interface on my iMac). I had a Galaxy Tab 2, which I liked for a while, but I also don't really love the Android interface for a tablet, although I love it for my phone. So, this has been the perfect solution. It's a laptop, but a tablet, but a laptop. It's just frickin' amazing. I also really like Windows 10. I stopped following Windows products when Windows 8 came out, but 10 has been a nice blend of 7 and 8. This really is the best of all worlds!
  
Read more

reviews.review:
I integrate Surface Pros with industrial instrumentation for customer interface.  I buy these frequently as replacements because they burn out in hot industrial environments or freeze when a customer tries too often to restart without the password.  These refurbs start up fine, appear as near new, have good battery life and function...  If you need a low cost tablet, this is a good option.  Just realize there are no user servicable parts outside of the power supply.  You can't change the screen or battery without special tools - not economic as cheaper to just buy another.  Sad but that is the world they have made for us.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Old USB-A Port, Not New USB-C
reviews.review:
This is a review for the i5-8GB-128GB model, renewed. It's a Surface Pro 6, so it doesn't have the newer USB-C connection - but that's fine for me, as I find USB-A just a little more convenient (bearing in mind that this isn't a primary computer for my family, but a casual tablet).Also, please note the price - I got this for a mite under $500, which makes it exceptional value today (early 2020), blowing the ~$400 Surface Go out of the water.Mine was "renewed" from Mastertronics, and everything looked good. The box had some rather large stickerage on it to make it clear it was renewed. Out of the box it wanted to run first-time W10 setup. After that, checking the battery showed that it had been cycled seven times already (good! Not EXCELLENT, but good!).There's not really much else to say that hasn't been covered by countless SP6 reviews. These renewed ones come without the excellent Type Cover or stylus, it's worth noting. It's a lovely, premium-feeling slab of tablet, without being too heavy (I can't even feel it in my backpack when it goes there in place of my ~2.1KG Acer R7-571 laptop). Battery life is good. So... that's it! $500 is such a bargain for a quality little machine like this, and in my case, the "renewed" version was completely problem-free.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Buyer Beware!!!
reviews.review:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    Please read before buying from this seller TechDeals4Less.Ordered a renewed Surface Pro 6 with in EXCELLENT condition with the followed specs:Brand  MicrosoftModel Name  Surface Pro 6Screen Size  12.3 InchesColor  PlatinumHard Disk Size  128 GBCPU Model  Core i5 8400TRam Memory Installed Size  8 GBOperating System  Windows 10These are refurbished so we were not expecting a new unit by any means, but we were expecting a working item without any functional issues.When we received the first unit, the first thing we noticed when turning it on, there were HORRIBLE brown dark spots all around the bottom of the screen. after getting into windows they were visibly noticeable in EVERYTHING you did on it. Also, the processor was not an I5 8400T.  While using windows, the brown spots turned into white spots and it was very annoying and unbearable to look at. We looked up troubleshooting tips to see if it was something that can be reset. It was recommended on Microsoft site to enter into UEFI mode and if the issue appears there, then it points to screen damage. We unfortunately did not take pictures and decided to have it replaced as the listing from Amazon does say it was eligible for a refund or replacement.We tried to setup an exchange but it told us that our product was not eligible for a return and that we had to contact Amazon. We did so and they informed us we had to return it an order another. Well that is not an exchange but a return. So what is the point of advertising that they offer the ability to exchange? We called back and a supervisor was able to setup the exchange. So we shipped back the item, same day, and a few days later, received the second Surface. WellllllCosmetically it was in worse shape then the first. But we were really not that upset about the exterior and it was going in a case anyway. However, we turned it on and was greeted to the exact same type of burn in white/brown spots (this time we took pictures, albeit not AS bad, but still very noticeable. This time we did the same things as the first unit and just went through windows setup and check to see if its working at all which lead to the next big problem with this unit, the touch screen was messed up. This is going to be kind of hard to show in pictures/video but the top part of the screen does not respond to touch inputs. So I used the tool to calibrate the touch and pen inputs and to no luck, it did not fix it. As someone who will be using this as a tablet more then a laptop, this was way more impossible to overlook then the burn in spots. Now that nothing about this product was in Excellent condition as described in the listing, we at least checked to make sure the specs are correct and things are running correctly to find that the CPU in our unit was not as the one described once again. This time the CPU was an i5-8350U.I would completely understand if the first unit we got was messed up and that mistakes happen or that this unit unfortunately got damaged in shipping, however the 2nd unit being messed up in the same exact manner raises a lot of questions and suspicion. I have a very hard time believing that this company is refurbishing these units when the first step after working on the product should be to turn on the unit and make sure everything is working. There is just no way I can imagine how you just glance over these screen and other issues TWICE. We are extremely disappointed and angry about this whole situation. See pictures and video.
  
Read more

    Seems to be a brand new Surface 6
reviews.review:
When you choose to purchase a refurbished item, you subject yourself to the luck of the draw. A tip of the hat to Amazon for at least grading each renewed item into one of three categories. I chose to purchase the top category which is "Excellent Condition," and indeed it is. The Surface 6 that I received is like new in every way except the packaging. The packaging is very good, but not the original box. Most importantly, the Surface 6 works perfectly and I cannot find even one small scratch on it. Your mileage may vary, but I think if you stick with "excellent condition'" then you'll be well satisfied. If not, you can take advantage of Amazon's generous return policy.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    PLEASE TAKE CAUTION!! There's an old saying that if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is
reviews.review:
I will say that I haven't had this laptop looked at by a professional yet however I will have that done in a couple of days and I will update my review . This is just a feeling that I have in my gut that this laptop isn't on the up and up there is something fishy with this purchase and I intend to sort it out . I take it very personal when somebody tries to take advantage of me and I will not rest until I get it figured out. That being said this laptop is extremely slow. In fact it is so slow it is almost unusable. I have performed a factory reset twice thus far and it runs fine at first but then a couple days later it's back to the way it was. It only does this when I'm connected to the internet. Service speed tested at or around 1gig.  . However if I'm not connected to the internet it's fine. I bought the same model years ago when it first came out. it still runs just a Snappy as it did on day one. I was so impressed with this laptop that I went and bought a refurbished one from here on Amazon.  I will say if I had the option to purchase one new I would have purchased One new but they no longer make this model so I was forced to buy a refurbished model from here on Amazon. for some reason a couple days in to the purchase, it starts running really slow. it won't upload or download things very quickly at all takes forever to open simple web pages on a 1gig web connection and I'm not having this issue with any other device. I start to wonder if they replaced components for off-brand components or something. I really dont know but Something simply  isn't right with this laptop.  I would not recommend anyone spend money on one of these "REFURBISHED" laptops. You're better off putting the money towards A new one.
  
Read more

reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great value, but not perfect
reviews.review:
This is a great machine!  We’ve always been a Mac family, but have moved away from it due to the high-dollars that mac wants for a new machine.For the money, this computer has it all.  It’s a laptop and a tablet in one package, it boots quickly, operates flawlessly...  there’s really not much to dislike.If there were one thing I could improve, it’d be the battery life in the tablet portion.  It’s not that long-lasting.  However, one thing that nobody seems to mention is that the power adapter plugs into the tablet portion, as well.So, if you’re looking to save literally thousands over buying both a Mac and an iPad, and don’t mind windows or the lessened tablet battery life, this is an excellent choice.I’d recommend it, but with those aforementioned disclaimers.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 19, 2024
reviews.title: Nice machine for the money
reviews.review:
I was slightly nervous buying this after reading some of the reviews, but as I could return if not happy, only cost will be wasted time.Anyway, time to get on with the actual product review .... I have coveted the Microsoft Surface range for years, but too pricey for me.  But when I needed a replacement laptop for my HP whose battery has failed yet again, I decided to look at a refurbed Surface.  Settled on a Book model for its flexibility with the removable screen.In terms of what was supplied, I was slightly disappointed in getting a unit with a ding in the screen casing in what was described as in "excellent" condition  (I have used Amazon Warehouse/Renewed for years and everything has looked like brand new).  The Laptop also came with totally discharged batteries which was also a surprise to see.But putting these two aside, after leaving to charge, I proceeded to complete the Windows installation, then upgrade to Windows 11 and then checked the spec of what was supplied.  I found I had the faster optional processor, twice the RAM expected and twice as large an SSD as expected, so a great result there which makes up for the screen ding.Had the laptop for just the 3 days but very happy with it.  Already bought some extras like the Surface Dock and USB-VGA and USB-HDMI adapters for the Dock so I can use as a Desktop replacement as well as a Laptop-cum-Tablet.only thing that is bugging me is the left shift key is a single key size and I keep hitting the "\" instead of the shift, but I will get used to that.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    One of the best PC laptop experiences I have ever had
reviews.review:
So I bought this laptop refurbished, which was new to me. I guess I was worried I'd get a beat up piece of used gear. Instead, this laptop came and seemed like it was absolutely brand new. The price was incredible for this laptop, which made it a solid chance to take. I recently bought a far more expensive Dell XPS 13 and it has been a complete pain. There are so many strange bugs and compatibility issues, and I felt like I wasted my money a bit. At this point, Microsoft and Apple are making amazing products that give you the best experience with their operating systems, and this Surface Laptop provided a wonderfully streamlined experience with no bloatware or bugs. I have been using it for months now and it has been so reliable and free of any issues. I also wanted to take advantage of the incredible Ryzen mobile processors with the AMD graphics, and though its not a gaming powerhouse, it has run all sorts of fun games. This is just a bonus. I would highly recommend this computer for work or school, as its value far exceeds the cost.

reviews.date: Reviewed in Mexico on June 20, 2025
reviews.title: Buen deal definitivamente
reviews.review:
La calidad de surface microsoft es inegable y si bien este articulo es reconstruido se nota que siguió un riguroso control de calidad. En mi caso llego con detalles esteticos un ligero raspon/golpe en una esquina que si bien no afecta su funcionalidad es notorio. En cuanto al OS tuve que descargar la imagen desde microsoft por lo cual es importante cuenten con el serial del equipo ya que este les habilita absolutamente todas las descargas que la surface llegara a necesitar.Despues de poco mas de 6 meses de uso moderado (office, web browsing, streaming services) la bateria aun me permite usarla poco mas de 6 horas con una carga y seguro puede alargarse con el ahorro de energía. El cargador es original y todos sus puertos llegaron en excelentes condiciones. Por los detalles estéticos es evidente que no es nueva sin embargo las teclas, el trackpad y los puertos no presentan el mas mínimo detalle de desgaste.Buena compra tomando en cuenta que es reconstruida y con descuento adicional. Excelente opción para un uso básico, comodo y autónomo ya que si esta buscando conectarla a un docking para multiples perifericos y/o monitores externos 4k se sobre calentara hasta apagarse. Sin embargo por si misma es suficiente para un uso personal moderado.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024
reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A Portable Do-It-All Computer
reviews.review:
I bought the Microsoft Surface Pro 9 Tablet recently to replace the HP Pavilion desktop that I purchased about five years ago.  My HP Pavilion had similar specs to the Microsoft Surface Pro 9 including the same Core i7 chip. I haven't bought a new computer in years, and I have to say I'm extremely impressed. The Surface Pro 9 basically does everything my old HP Pavilion desktop did (and a lot more) in a slim tablet that's just a fraction of its size. The Surface Pro 9 boots up very fast, in just seconds actually. I love the touch-screen functionality which is very useful. The screen is brilliant and vibrant and colorful, perfect for Youtube, Netflix, etc.  The internal hard drive is small, but I have an external 4Tbyte hard drive that I connect to it so that solves that problem. I'd recommend a similar fix if you're not happy about the small hard drive. The Surface Pro 9 is portable, quiet and doesn't generate a lot of heat. You can buy external docking station (as I did) for $30 that will physically connect to the Surface Pro 9 and add lots of connectable ports for USB drives, external drives, an HDMI cable, etc. Also, don't forget to buy an external keyboard both to protect the screen and for laptop functionality. The Microsoft Surface Pro 9 is a real little workhorse that effortlessly replaces a desktop - and it's lightweight and portable too!  The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars as opposed to 5 is because this thing just gobbles up electrical charge. The manufacturer claims it runs on a fully-charged battery for up to 15 hours. Not in my experience, no way. In my experience you'll be lucky if you get even half that time on a fully-charged battery. Of course, the Surface Pro 9 comes with a charger, but you're going to find that you need to be near an electrical outlet most of the time or this thing will run down its battery real fast. Just saying. Other than that, the Microsoft Surface Pro 9 is a great machine and a great buy. Highly recommended.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Perfect macbook alternative!
reviews.review:
When I was on the search for a new laptop, I was debating on whether to switch to macbook after being a window user for years because I really like the aesthetic of the macbook but when I came across this laptop, I was immediately drawn to it because it looks exactly like a macbook but with a windows operating system and so far I really like it!Since it's much smaller than my older 15.6 inch laptop, it will definitely take some time for me to get used to it but I like how lighter it is and it was also really easy to set up.The reason why I'm giving it 4 stars though is because the second time I went on it to watch a live stream, the audio kept making static/crackly noises and the problem continued when I tried watching YouTube videos, but now the third time I used it, I didn't really hear any static sounds so I don't know what was up with that, but I figure it's probably a software issue that might be easily resolved by updating the computer.Also this laptop isn't the most powerful so don't expect to use it to play games. I got the laptop just to write books on and do basic web browsing so I don't mind it not being super powerful.Regarding the overheating issue, it does get hot when you let it sit on top of a blanket but if you sit it on carpet or a desk, it doesn't get as hot.Either way, I highly recommend this laptop if you're looking for something inexpensive that looks like a macbook!
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2024
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    love the simplicity of this laptop
reviews.review:
I needed a laptop for pretty basic needs:  writing Word Docs, sending emails, paying bills, filing my taxes.  I wanted something simple, and a laptop that is fast.  In the past, I've used Dell, and they were frustratingly slow.  What I love most about this laptop is:  (1) incredibly easy to set up and transfer everything over from my old laptop, utilizing my Microsoft account; (2) small, light, and sharp looking; (3) being able to use either the cursor or touch screen, and (4) its fast.  The only drawbacks I have experienced thus far are: (1) because of the small screen, sometimes when I'm accessing online forms to fill out, some of the form is outside the window, and I am unable to adjust things to make it appear/fit in.  This doesn't happen too often, but when it does, it's frustrating; (2) sometimes, when I'm operating the laptop on battery power, the screen is very dark and I can barely see it; and when I've tried to adjust the brightness, it doesn't help, so the only solution is to plug it in, which increases the brightness of the screen; and (3) given the small screen size, the font is hard to see; but that was my choice when purchasing this, and you CAN expand the window with your fingers on the screen, so you can overcome that.  It's only been about a month, but all in all I've been very pleased.

    Start up process is a PITA!
reviews.review:
I like the product.  However, the setup is a PITA!  The operating system forces you into a sign on or sign up for a Microsoft account.  Can't be bypassed!  I have a Microsoft account, HOWEVER, the sign on process keeps advising me that I can't use a personal account.  It must be a Student or Business sign up.. There is NO option to create a new account!  Using my desktop computer and searching for the Pro 9 sign on issue I found a work around.  BIG NEWS!  DON'T enable the Internet connection at sign on!!!  This allows a local ID set up.  After I went in and disabled the WIFI card I was able to get ito the system.  After the the start up issue the machine works as expected.  Nice screen, normal Windoz 11 user interface, lots of extra stuff to unload.  So far I'm happy.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024
reviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Missing Accessories in Excellent Condition, Needed Reset
reviews.review:
The product came in okay condition with about 76% battery life remaining. Some scratches around the edges where tools were used and other marks indicating wear. Seems more like a fair or good condition item.It’s smaller than a 2020 IPad Pro, so quite a lot more portable.My particular Surface was missing its keyboard and pen, despite amazon labeling this device as “excellent” which amazon determines this item should have its pen and type cover-witness marks of both items are present on this device.Amazon renewed uses a dated reformatting system to wipe the product clean before shipping ‘renewed’ which causes some issues. Firstly, it gets reformatted with tech for a windows PC, not a surface. This causes issues with the on screen keyboard not appearing (this can be counteracted in accessibility settings for a more difficult to use on screen keyboard) and long press right click being disabled.To remedy these issues, Microsoft has a guide for resetting surface devices using their files and a 16+GB USB drive. If you can format a hard drive and run settings, you’ll do great.Otherwise, this little tablet/laptop is decent for school. I’d recommend ensuring you have the budget for a keyboard cover and surface pen on top of this device.
  
Read more

reviews.review:

It is listed as a Core i5 8400T, but in reality, it is an i5-8350U, which means it has fewer cores. Upon further investigation, I discovered that there is no Surface Pro with an i5 8400T as described. Despite this, the tablet is reasonably priced and performs well. I would recommend potential buyers to ensure they are comfortable with the i5-8350U processor if they decide to order it. Additionally, it's advisable to check for updated descriptions before making a purchase, as the discrepancy in the processor information may not have been rectified.

I purchased a refurbished Surface 4 hoping to use it as a lightweight work device. I chose a refurbished device to perhaps save some money and keep an old, but otherwise useful, device from the landfill.I wish the absolute lemon of a device I received was in a landfill.Appearances were, at first, good. As standard for used devices it shipped with no documentation, only a power cord. It was wrapped and shipped quite well, and it was clearly cleaned before shipment. There was only one very tiny (less than 1mm in length) chip in the metal case which took me some time to notice. In terms of external quality the device looked excellent. Unfortunately, the excellent outsides belied the irredeemable insides.The device was nearly inoperable, and is utterly beyond saving by a normal user. When performing first time set up problems quickly became apparent. Touch controls did not work for this touch screen tablet computer. The device came without a pen or keyboard, and I was fine with this as I did not expect a used device to come with peripherals. However what was not fine was the fact that the device would not register touch inputs outside of the "power+volume up" menu. Touching would not move the cursor, touching would not bring up the on screen keyboard, touching the *touch surface* of this Surface Pro tablet did nothing whatsoever.Fine, perhaps the device expects you to have a keyboard or some other peripheral. I plugged in a USB mouse and was able to, with some difficulty, complete first time start up and connect my device to my internet. My problems were not yet over.Now on the windows desktop home screen new problems set in. I attempted to update the system - as I thought perhaps an update to the device's software would correct the device's issues. Here I ran into something rather novel, the settings menu would not open. No matter how many times I clicked, no matter how many resets I performed, I could not open the settings menu in order to update the device. I tried sifting through the menus to try to find some setting or other that might turn on touch controls, or otherwise render my device operable but, alas, nothing.At this point, frustrated with the increasingly useless device I had spent $274 on, I resolved to try a factory reset. As the settings menu obstinately resisted any attempt to bring it up, I brought up the command prompt and (still using a usb mouse and the on screen keyboard) entered "systemreset".Enter the final, most damning, issue with this device - the battery. During multiple attempts at a system reset the device blue screened. The issue, I suspect, is the battery which cannot hold a charge. The device, by some miracle, shipped with the correct power cable. The cable was apparently the only thing about the device that could handle electricity. The machine holds no charge and instantly turns off the moment the cable is unplugged. The battery, I suspect, is fully cooked, or somehow removed. In any case, the machine would be useless for my intended purposes in such a state, even if the touch controls worked at all.In summation the machine I was sent:1. Would not respond to touch inputs2. Would not load key functions on the operating system3. Blue screened several times4. Had a battery life of approximately 0 secondsUsed and refurbished electronics are always a "your mileage may vary" proposition - especially in sight unseen purchases like over Amazon. Based on other reviews many people are happy with the devices they received, and you might be too should you order from Amazon Refurbished. I warn you, however, that your mileage might be like mine: a beautiful condition but useless device with an even more useless battery.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Don't buy this refurbished from Amazon. We've gotten 6 from Amazon and 5 were clearly lemons.
reviews.review:
I love Amazon and I love buying refurbished, so when we needed several of these as security camera monitors, this seemed like a great solution. We bought them a couple at a time over the course of several months, and from different sellers, and all but ONE were lemons. Fortunately, we discovered it before Amazon's generous return window on all but one of them, so we're only out the cost of one of these. Most of them had screen problems that weren't apparent until it was used continuously for an hour or more. Some of them were clearly heat-related issues that could be temporarily resolved by not using the screen for a while or by putting them in the fridge briefly, though that of course is not an acceptable state of affairs for a Surface.One of them had a non-OEM screen that had clearly been replaced, and it was about 1/2 or 1/3 the dpi of what the device should have. It was like looking at a laptop screen from twenty years ago through a screen door, and it was obvious that someone scamming Amazon. In that instance, clearly nobody at Amazon had even turned it on to attempt to vet it, because the comically low DPI was blatantly obvious as soon as the screen displayed anything at all at startup.Amazon was accommodating at taking them all back within the lengthy return window, which I appreciated, but it's clear that there are a number of people sending Amazon devices they claim are good which are clearly not. 1 good one out of 6 is not a good success rate, and we lost several hundred dollars on the one whose screen failed after a few months (beyond the return window). I don't know what processes Amazon has for "refurbishing" these, but whatever it is, it's not working very well. I won't buy any more of these from Amazon.
  
Read more

    Make sure you read the full description - does not ship with Windows 10 Pro
reviews.review:
Be careful when buying this unit on this listing: when I purchased this unit from this seller, the written description at the top of the listing under "About This Item" stated that this unit ships with Windows 10 Pro, but the unit I received came with Windows 10 Home. When I contacted Amazon customer service about it, they pointed out that under "Other Technical Details" towards the bottom under Product Information, the listing stated that the unit shipped with Windows 10 Home. I did not check that second section because I had assumed that the information given at the top would have already answered the question of which operating system it had.Maddeningly, Amazon's customer service hid behind that second part, stating that it was important to read the entire listing. They offered to let me return the unit for a refund and purchase a unit which came with Windows 10 Pro, but I opted to keep it and eat the cost of a Windows license upgrade, as it was ultimately the cheaper option for the hardware specs I needed.All of that aside, the Surface Pro 7 is a fantastic Windows tablet. It performs well, has a great screen and connectivity, and when combined with the optional type cover, is one of the best options out there for Windows users in need of performance and portability.

reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great art tablet.
reviews.review:
I use this for drawing on-the-go. At home, I have a much heavier pen display as a secondary monitor in a 3-screen setup. This tablet is nowhere near as good as that... but it works well for a mobile device. I bought an aftermarket pen from Renaisser to get a better pen for it. The pen works well with Adobe and Serif products but does not work with Krita. I've had 2 months to fix Krita and could not figure it out.This tablet is good for drawing, but it gets a lot better in general once you add a type cover. If you don't get a type cover for it, you will have a bad time, because it relies on the type cover for a lot of features. The type cover also helps protect the screen.I would recommend the Pro 7 model as a good Windows 10 device, but it is a little dated. You have to be OK with some qwerks, like the pen has to go on the outside of the tablet, not in the type cover. The default pen also doesn't work well... but the Renaisser pen works quite well. Overall, it's worth the money saved to go to the older model in my opinion. That's an opinion, though, and you have to make up your own mind about that.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Not a reliable device
reviews.review:
I purchased this product from Amazon on May 11, 2023. Initially, I was content with the purchase; however, over time, I noticed a decrease in responsiveness when using it as a notebook for writing. Given that I acquired this product primarily for my school needs, I was quite disappointed. Unfortunately, my disappointment escalated when the product suddenly malfunctioned, rendering it inoperable. Despite my attempts, I haven't been able to power it back on. Upon reviewing the return policy, I noticed that the expiration date was set for August 9, 2023, just about two weeks from now.I reached out to Amazon customer service to discuss the possibility of a return or refund. While I initially received some assurance from one of your associates, another representative later informed me that this wouldn't be possible, directing me to the original seller. Subsequently, the seller's chatbot indicated that they aren't responsible for items sold through Amazon, effectively leaving me without a recourse after the return window.This experience has been disheartening, especially coming from a reputable company like Amazon. I believe that products offered by such a well-regarded entity should demonstrate reliability and longevity, lasting beyond a short return period. This incident has left me hesitant to recommend Amazon and that specific seller to others seeking reliable products. It's my belief that a few extra dollars spent on a new device is a wiser investment than navigating these challenges.
  
Read more

reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent Versatility with Minor Drawbacks
reviews.review:
Excellent Versatility with Minor DrawbacksThe Microsoft Surface Pro 7 is an impressive device that blends the functionality of a tablet and a laptop seamlessly. The 12.3-inch touchscreen is bright and responsive, making it great for drawing, note-taking, and multimedia use. The performance is solid, handling multitasking and productivity apps with ease.The versatility of switching between tablet and laptop mode is fantastic, especially with the optional Type Cover keyboard and Surface Pen (sold separately). The lightweight design makes it perfect for on-the-go use.However, the battery life could be better—it doesn’t last as long as I’d hoped, especially during heavy use. Additionally, the lack of ports can be limiting if you need to connect multiple devices.Overall, the Surface Pro 7 is a powerful, sleek, and versatile device that’s almost perfect for students, professionals, and creatives alike.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2022
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fantastic laptop, just make sure this is the type you want.
reviews.review:
If you need a discounted, lightweight, quality laptop with a ton of nice features, GET THIS. Before you read on, know that it would be very difficult to ever change out the battery, the bottom is not screwed in because it is all one piece. It should last a long time though. Mine had absolutely no wear on it, couldn't tell it was refurbished at all. The Pixelsense screen is amazing. Note that the dimentions are 3:2, which is a little taller than most other laptops, which are 4:3 or 16:9. This may be awkward for watching movies and such, but is perfect for schoolwork. It is crazy light and thin, the alcantara keyboard is my personal favorite. It doesn't ever feel like it gets greasy. The startup time is very quick, especially with Windows Hello. My favorite feature so far is the soft-closing, so it doesnt ever slam, even when you give it a bit of pressure. The battery-life is exactly what i wanted too. You won't regret getting this if you're looking for a quality school laptop, especially at this price range.
