reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2020
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I miss my XL keyboard but...
reviews.review:
...this is perfect for school! My traditional laptop just bit the dust and I decided it was time to jump on the bandwagon and get a tablet laptop like my classmates. It definitely took some getting used to but I LOVE being able to insert PowerPoints into a Microsoft Notebook and write directly on them instead of keeping track of dozens of print outs. Like I said in my title, I miss my XL keyboard (with separated number keypad), but the type cover is decent enough. I have issues typing quickly in it but most of my school work is note taking anyways. Maybe next tax season I’ll break down and get a Bluetooth keyboard for home use but for now the type cover will do.  Screen size is a little small for my taste but it’s perfect for school and you can find a $30 attachment on Amazon that allows you to hook up a regular HDMI and add a secondary screen if desired. My only legitimate complaint is that everything is sold separately. I appreciate the ability to customize and choose your mouse, pen, and type cover color but all of those pieces are needed to effectively use this machine. You at least need the pen or type cover, otherwise you have to tap out notes and web searches on a weird on-screen keyboard. Just be prepared to spend more than you think, it adds up quickly!!
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Arrived and would consistently crash/blue screen of death!
reviews.review:
My surface pro 6 arrived and I was very excited to use it, but as soon as I started to set it up it got stuck on the windows boot screen. I did a quick google search for my problem and wrote it off as a usual update or problem that a lot of people experience, I mean the product I received looked brand new so I gave it the benefit of the doubt. After about 4 hours I finally finished setting up windows, got into windows set up my account and it worked fine for about a day. After that day I went into the settings menu to change my wallpaper and noticed that my windows were flickering and flashing blue now and then. I ended up figuring out that it only happened in windows programs and menus (i.e. OneNote was one that I planned on using a lot but couldn't due to the window flashing and resetting every 30 seconds). I wrote it off as a regular issue and just restarted it, after restarting it the problem persisted and crashed the PC a couple of times with a blue screen of death. After running diagnostics on why the computer crashed I tried updating to the most recent version of windows. Found out that didn't help either and it kept crashing. Ran diagnostics again, did some research, and found out that it was coming down to a hardware issue. I tried resetting to a clean version of windows, but that did not help either and the menus in the setup started flashing too. I gave up and made a return request and plan on re-purchasing after receiving my refund since they couldn't do a replacement. I'll change this review if my newer one works fine, but as of now, this is my experience.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2023
reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Refurbished Surface Pro 6, i5-8350U, 8GB ram, 256GB SSD
reviews.review:
Had bought a refurbished Surface Pro 4 off of Amazon a couple of years ago that was like new and is still going strong for use as my office video streamer and as my beater travel laptop. Bought this “refurbished” Surface Pro 6 as a gift for a family member who is mainly going to use it for surfing the internet, streaming video, email, and light (very light/retro) gaming.What was in the box:-Surface Pro 6 Tablet-Surface Pro 6 charging cablePurchased separately:-Refurbished Microsoft FMM-00001 Type Cover for Surface ProPros:-8th generation Intel processor - oldest Surface Pro model that can be updated to run Windows 11 (at least officially – have Windows 11 on my Surface Pro 4, but had to jump through some hoops to get it to install since 11 is not officially supported on the 4)-8GB ram when some models in the older generations of Surface Pros only had 4GB. Windows 10 and 11 will run with only 4, but both run better with 8 or more.-256 GB SSD – larger storage always better, but IMO 256 GB is the current minimum that I feel comfortable with on a newer PC. Anything less seems to fill quicker than you expect.-MicroSD card slot – again, more storage always better and this allows you to expand it a bit if needed. Threw an old 128GB card I had into it. Latest 2 versions of the Surface Pro (8 & 9) no longer have a microSD card slot.-Has 1 USB 3.0 type A port– 2 would have been nicer and I get the advantages that the USB-C ports on the newer Surface Pros have, but at least one older USB A port is nice to have for use with legacy USB equipment (mouse, game controller, flash drives).-No fans. Had read a review on here that stated that the i5 version didn’t have fans where as the i7 version did. Didn’t believe it until it arrived. Could be a negative for others if you want to try and push this system to run anything taxing as lack of fans could cause throttling if it starts to overheat, but no fans a plus for purposes for which this one will be used.Cons:-Sold as refurbished in Excellent condition. IMO opinion, should have been rated Very Good vs Excellent. Screen was like new, but corners and kickstand have several scuff marks- like it was dropped at least a couple of times. Since it’s the black model, was able to cover scuffs with a black permanent marker.-8th generation Intel cpu now 5 generations behind, so not the latest, greatest.-Surface Pro 6 now 3 generations behind latest Surface Pro versions, so support and updating device specific drivers no longer a priority for Microsoft-Next to impossible for the average person to update or replace anything in the Surface Pros as doing so requires prying off the screen and likely breaking it vs some other laptops that make it easy to replace or upgrade at least the ram and harddrives/SSDs. Can now easily replace SSDs on the newer Surface Pro models (7+ (not the 7), 8, and 9), but not on models that came before them like this 6. Once battery dies, likely means having to replace the entire system.Neutral-Battery came with no charge. Tried charging for 30 minutes before booting first time and still at 0%. Fortunately, would boot when plugged in. Known issue with some Surface Pro models was that one of Microsoft’s driver updates caused those models to stop charging. Downloaded and installed latest drivers for the Surface Pro 6 and it started charging and charged to 100% in about an hour and a half.-Took about 2 hours to set up and then download and update from Windows 10 to 11. An annoyance you have with all “new” Windows PCs.Summary:Happy with the purchase as is the family member it was gifted to. While not the latest version, it’s still perfectly useful for everyday tasks. The build quality of the Surface Pro is in a class of their own as far as Windows devices go. Hope to get a good 3 years of use out of it.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Amazon Renewed has set a new Bar - A Journey of Surprise and Satisfaction
reviews.review:
MY EXPERIENCEI was speechless for the most part when I opened up my box with the smiley face on it.This device must have fell of the back of the truck of new devices being sent to the store.  It is absolutely flawless, not a scratch, ding, or even fingerprint.  I can tell it has never been used, as both batteries are 98/99% capacity.I wonder if all renewed devices are like this...well this one was, so my experience was amazing.TECH SPECSGPU: Nvidia Quadro RTX 3000 with Max-Q DesignMemory: 32GBSSD: 512GB Toshiba KBG40ZNS512G (NVMe, M2.2230, PCIe 3.0, Read 2,200mb, Write 1,400mb)CPU: Intel i7-1065G7  (4 cores, 8 Threads, Max Turbo 3.90 GHz, Base Freq 1.30 GHz)Screen Size: 15"Display Res: 3240x2160Weight: Almost 5lbs (4.20lbs) with the keyboard base, 3rd of that (1.80lbs) for the tablet onlyOS: Windows Pro 11 (fully licensed)Not the fastest SSD on the market, but it's blazing for what I need, and what the book can do.RECOMMENDATIONSIf you're planning to run multiple monitors, or other peripherals, get the official Microsoft Docking station, will make your life way easier (and charge your battery 40% faster).CONSYes, there is one believe it or not:No Thunderbolt port...BUT, the Microsoft Docking Station makes up for this.IMPORTANT CAVEAT !!!Your GPU will not show up until your battery life is at least 10% charged.  I thought I had a regular Intel GPU at first, and fell out initially...CONCLUSIONHappy camper, thanks Amazon.

    Device in overall great shape, near mint, bad W10 product key however
reviews.review:

No dents or nicks anywhere, but a small barely visible scuff on one key and extremely minor markings where the screen bezel touches the bottom when the laptop is closed, I really had to look for it to see it.The screen is immaculate, no sign of warping or distortion (the stock slight concave nature of the screen aside, as it should be) and no scratches whatsoever. All ports are clean (no debris or markings around them). Battery capacity appears to be stock or very near stock. All fans sounds even and operational.  The screen attachment mechanism is in perfect shape (I have been using the 13" version for quite awhile, this one is just a sturdy if not even better).One problem though: Came with W10 Pro installed, but the product key used was for W10 Home. Luckily I had an extra Pro key, but be aware this might be a possibility.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2021
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Powerful laptop in a small form
reviews.review:
I love this Surface Pro 7. I invested in this to use for school and take notes in the office apps for classes and this is just a dream to use. Given you need to buy the type cover and the surface pen, it's a great purchase overall. Small and sleek to hide in your backpack, a lightweight item that wont bog you down, with all the power of windows 10. It comes with windows 10 pro preloaded, and a great screen. Taking notes on this "tablet" is milky smooth with the surface pen, it detects pressure and makes thicker strokes in OneNote, its like buttery smooth and works like a charm. Its palm rejection is okay, sometimes my hand presses another section of my notes which throws me off sometimes but it happens rarely. Given its refurbished, the battery life isn't the best compared to when you buy a new one, but it gets me through the day and handles all my tasks for the day, from emails to note taking to just simple video consumption, this laptop does it all. Plus it's a steal for the price and you save a few hundred as it still has a powerful processor and can handle heavy tasks or many open apps at once. You can always get a bluetooth keyboard and get the pen if you need it for handwriting notes or just to draw. It does it all. I give this product a glowing recommendation and think its a great purchase for the price point, compared to buying it new, even though buying it new comes with the type cover. At least you can customize it in your way. Hope this helped your buying process!
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This is an amazing value
reviews.review:
OK, I'll admit: I was extremely skeptical when buying this "renewed" laptop. I can't tell you how many times I've bought a "refurbished" device only to receive something that looked and performed like it had been to war. Echoing what others have said, this is the exact opposite. My laptop came well-packaged and it comes in Microsoft Certified Refurbished white box. It was even packaged like it was brand new with the plastic wrap on the device and accessories (which were also new). Furthermore, there were no signs of wear or use on the laptop. It looks like a brand new device. I checked the battery health (both with Windows and Linux) and both report the battery at 100% health. In fact, Windows had the cycle count at 2.For the laptop itself, I'm very impressed with the Surface Laptop Go. I was coming from a Chuwi laptop, which was good in its own right, but I can't believe how premium this laptop is. It's fast, well-built and handles anything I need to do on it. Admittedly, I was worried about the display resolution, but after using the device, I can say it was unfounded. The display on this thing is fantastic. Where it falls short on the resolution numbers, it makes up by being a fantastic panel. The keyboard and trackpad are great. I understand that people miss the backlit keyboard, but that's a non-issue for me. I usually turn that feature off to save on battery. The sound quality is also great. It's loud with good clarity. I can't speak on the battery life, yet, but it seems average so far. Being a Microsoft device, Windows 11 is a pleasant experience. However, if you're a Linux fan (like me), you'll be happy to know that everything works out of the box.Overall, I am extremely pleased. The condition, value and performance of the laptop are all fantastic. I can't speak of the longevity of the laptop, but everything seems great so far. Sure, there are better value options out there (Chuwi, Alldocube, etc.) in this price segment, but I worried about the quality control with those devices. I would definitely purchase this again.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2022
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great little mobile laptop.  Buy the renewed ones for great value
reviews.review:
It's small and cute.  Nice ice blue color (rather than plain silver).  Display isn't bad even if it isn't full 1080P.  Battery life >> guess it's ok since you can't fit big batteries in this small footprint.  Computing power is adequate for business use (MS Office) but not photoshop stuff.  I will use my ipads for that.So I haven't used windows PC for about 6, 7 years since I quit my company office job and didn't need Microsoft Office or any business apps.  Was using ipads for most of my web activities, which is pretty good.However, I have once again started some jobs that require office apps and decided on this "renewed" Surface Laptop Go (I first purchased Surface Go 3, but it didn't quite stand up to my needs for office use).First of all, "renewed" isn't like what you see on ebay or craigslist.  It's professionally packaged, just like Apple refurbished products that you purchase directly from Apple.  Mine had almost 10months warranty remaining.  Battery capacity was 100%.  It's just great value to go for renewed.  The price also has dropped considerably now.  I think you can get if for less than $500.It's a great value.  Again, if you just need basic computing needs, don't do any graphics intense stuff like video editing or games (although it does some games quite well), and don't mind the small screen, and need to take your laptop with you at all times, this is perfect.By the way, when I work at home, I do have an external display.  I purchased a 24" monitor for about $150.  With dual monitor set-up, it really boosts your productivity.  All this for less than $800.  Super happy that I purchased this.So, just crossing my fingers that there won't be any issues with it in the long run.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2016
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Brand New, looks like never used.
reviews.review:
EDIT:After 2 weeks of use in a college environment I have found the Surface 3 to be quite capable. It hasn't been problem free however. Having never owned a tablet this was a new experience for me.My connection to the college wireless has been spotty, whereas the connection on my Nexus 5x with the college wireless has been pretty spot on. I get better connections inside with the Surface 3 while in the lecture halls, but it may require multiple refreshes. The college requires mac address registration for all devices accessing its wireless. There is no mac address on a label on the outside of the Surface 3 so you have to go into the console commands and do an ipconfig query and look at the 'physical address'.The preloaded app called Drawboard PDF is a horrible program. It works great for 15 or so minutes and then your finger/pen strokes start to display slower and slower and slower until you are waiting for minutes for something you drew to show up. Eventually the app crashes. I attempted to get customer support and received an automated reply a week ago promising a follow up. I am still waiting. Of course I discovered that OneNote does everything Drawboard PDF does plus a hundred more things... and OneNote doesn't have the slow down problem at all.I have since purchased a Microsoft Surface Pen for Surface Pro 4, and a used Microsoft Surface 3 Type Cover to complete the ensemble. The Pen is amazing, the keyboard is a little too floppy for lap use because in a lecture hall you rarely get a desk to place your laptop on. My solution to the floppy keyboard problem was to get a Leather Folio Cover which offers more rigidityOverall, I have now spent much more money than I had originally intended. I spent $550 in total, not including tax. I used Prime for all parts, so no shipping costs. For $550 there are several faster laptops with more storage I could have purchased but wouldn't have gotten the modularity or touch/pen capabilities. So, I'm finding myself adapt to this different paradigm instead of it adapting to me.ORIGINAL REVIEW:After reading some of the 1 star reviews here I was worried. I made sure to select a unit in the list that specified new condition.So far so good. I've unboxed it and found the unit to be brand new with the exception that it had a refurbished sticker added to the back of the unit and included a newsprint booklet saying it was a refurb. The packaging was flawless. I plugged it into power and turned it on and was greeted by the first user experience and intro for Windows 10. This took a few minutes because I turned off some options for privacy and setup wireless. It had a 20% charge on the battery. There were about a dozen updates that needed to be done. Using the Drawboard PDF app, pre-installed, without a pen went quite well as this was the type of application I had in mind for taking notes during lectures.At this point in time I am quite pleased with it. The unit is in perfect condition without any blemishes.I will update this review only if I find something wrong.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2017
reviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    NO WARRANTY as advertised...doesn't work out of the box...run don't walk to buy from a different vendor
reviews.review:
False advertising for this product.  The ad clearly says it has a ONE YEAR manufacturers warranty from Microsoft.  That is 100% FALSE in my case.  My item arrived and did not work..the dreaded BATTERY PLUGGED in but not charging problem that seems to be common with the Surface products.  I went to every forum, went to every video on how to fix this problem no luck. Called Microsoft for support and low and behold the warranty on this product had expired almost 6 months ago in June  2017.  So NO WARRANTY as promised.  Microsoft offered to renew the warranty at $29.00 a month or around $150 a year..yikes almost as much as the unit cost....So here I sit with a worthless piece of junk I have am going to have to send back, refurbished means they must have cleaned the unit with a cloth and put it in a box. Obviously nobody checked it, the battery would never charge beyond 50% when totally off..(never will charge plugged in) so that tells me it's the old original battery and is on it's way out..again refurbished why didn't they try charging the battery?  Why didn't someone plug this in and see if the battery actually charged before they sold it.BEWARE.. do NOT, do NOT buy these refurbished products..spend a bit more money and get a NEW ONE.....this is a joke, a travesty and a blatant lie on their ad. I would NEVER have bought this if it didn't say it came with  a one year warranty....and that turned out to be 100% BS....Very disappointed --Note today is 11/5/2017.  Microsoft pulled up this page for with the photo attached for  me showing this device has an expired warranty and that it expired june 3 2017.  Very sad that they are allowed to get away with peddling this type of nonsense.Microsoft Surface 3 Tablet (10.8-Inch, 64 GB, Intel Atom, Windows 10) (Certified Refurbished)

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2016
reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    One of the best decisions I have ever made.
reviews.review:
Where do I begin to talk about the Microsoft Surface 3?I had originally bought the Surface 3 more as a novelty if anything. I use an 8" Samsung Tab for work, and fiddling around with it had always tempted me to go out and buy my own. I've always been a fan of Microsoft products (I use Windows for both my laptop as well as phone) so I wanted to complete my own little ecosystem. I had only intended to have the Surface 3 as a tablet for browsing the web and reading articles from the comfort of my living room couch.Well.. that was my original intention... Fast forward to a month and a half later, and I'm using the Surface 3 daily. I use it for all my office needs - creating powerpoints for my lectures, and writing reports up as well. When it comes to meetings, I flip the keyboard under and pull out my Surface Pen to handwrite notes on Nebo. It's light and it's compact, and the fact that it uses a micro-USB to charge instead of a proprietary charger? I really don't have an excuse not to have it with me. I get so much more mileage out of it than the Android tab I have to use for work that I've gradually replaced it more and more. I've also gotten a lot of questions and comments from people about the looks and how productive I find it.The Surface 3 has completely changed my life and my only regret is not having bought one sooner.Some things to note: I purchased the 4gb Surface 3 (as opposed to the 2gb version), along with the Type Cover, Surface Pen, and Arc Mouse.
  
Read more

availability_status: In Stock
feature_bullets: Surface Laptop SE ships with an Intel Celeron N4020 and N4120 CPU, with 4GB or 8GB RAM options, 64GB or 128GB storage, and an 11.6-inch 1366x768 display. The display is not touchscreen, which is a first for the Surface line.
Surface Laptop SE features one USB-A port, one USB-C port, a headphone jack, and a barrel-style AC port.
The exterior is all plastic, with a full-sized laptop keyboard and trackpad borrowed from the Surface Laptop Go.

Surface Laptop SE ships with a new edition of Windows 11 called Windows 11 SE, designed specifically for education PCs. This is not an edition of Windows that you'll find on normal consumer or professional grade PCs, as it's a SKU that only hardware makers can order to pre-load onto devices designed specifically for the low-end education sector.

It features optimizations, tweaks, and policy changes designed for the education sector. Some of the tweaks made to Windows 11 SE include limiting the multitasking/snapping options to just side-by-side, locking down access to This PC in the File Explorer, and much more. Windows 11 SE PCs are required to be Intune managed too.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Really Nice Laptop/Tablet Hybrid!
reviews.review:
I love this little thing! It's not super small, but it's not very big either. I use it without the keyboard a lot as a reading tablet with the Kindle PC application and I love it! I have a matte screen protector so it looks and feels more like paper and doesn't cling onto finger prints. My only issue with it is that it's kind of slow and lags when opening applications and browsers and the face recognition feature tends to not be able to recognize my face when I first power it on. Not a huge deal, but can be kind of irritating. I have ADHD so I get frustrated when computers lag or take a long time to load because I'm in hyperfocus mode and trying to get something done before I forget or lose interest. Luckily I don't have that issue very often, but it does happen. Also, I can use my Silhouette software on it like a normal laptop so that's a huge plus for me. It connects and works like a charm majority of the time which was a huge thing I was looking for when looking for a new laptop. Overall, I really like it and I'd recommend it. If you're looking for something to use as a tablet but also needs PC abilities for certain applications, I'd go with this or the Surface Pro if it's within your budget. If you're looking for a tablet to use for artistry and just general web browsing, I'd say the iPad Pros are a better choice for that field as they are more tailored to those capabilities. I will also add that I have a generic brand keyboard, Bluetooth mouse, and USB/HDMI adapter that all work really well with no issues with this device.
  
Read more

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Debating How I Feel
reviews.review:
I’ll start with, the item came a day sooner than originally scheduled, so that was nice. I want to love it, the size is great, weight is great, and it’s running smooth…..right now, literally just got it. However, drum roll please, I am not pleased completely with the condition of the device. I purchased an excellent condition renewed device and I got more of a good condition device which is listed at about $20 less. I went with excellent for this particular item because I wanted to avoid the chance of screen scratches. I’ve ordered refurb from Amazon before and it’s been great, actually I ordered a good condition paper white and it came in excellent condition. Leading me to try it again….but it seems like the opposite happened this time. The back is really scratched up, you can tell the device got a lot of use, fine, that can be covered with a case (I’m not that picky). But the scratches are bugging me out. Per Amazon Cosmetic Conditions of an Excellent Condition Renewed device you shouldn’t be able to see damage at 12in away. I took a couple pics at 12in away and you can see the scratches. Not only that you can feel them. I’m just worried they may get bigger with time and start causing issues. I’m up for a resolution. I guess I’ll get in contact with the buyer. I dislike leaving bad reviews but it’s helpful to leave accurate reviews so customers know what to expect. Will update review later….hope I’m backed up by that 90-day Amazon guarantee….til then… hope this helps you make your decision because it took me a minute to make mine.Update: I reached out to Amazon and I’ll be receiving a replacement…..keep you posted.
  
Read more
